page.title: 03LEATON KNOLLS AREA
page.content: A quiet country area ,but only about 2 miles from Shrewsbury. The area has few inhabitants,living mainly in 18th or 19th century brick houses,with some modern housing.The main visible occupation is farming or smallholding.Amenities are few _ telephones,electricity and a post box.Much of the land is on a private estate,with large fields (arable), enclosed with hedgerows.Some of the land is unimproved grass & in places slopes steeply down to the river.There are patches of isolated deciduous woodland or single trees. Within the Isle,Bicton,there is the Prince Albert Angling Society,which has contacts in Macclesfield.
